text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Jordan receives $100 million worth of U.S. military equipment; King Hussein says "will continue to be committed to attaining stability, peace and security".
- Jordanian-Tunisian committee meets on Monday to discuss ways of increasing cooperation.
- Parliament to discuss draft law on standardising fees on imported and re-exported goods.
- King stresses illegality of Israeli settlement-building in West Bank, importance of modernising army.
- First conference of Arab political parties starts on Monday.
- Fire extinguished in textiles firm in Sahab industrial zone.
- Uncertainty over extent of Jordan's gains under oil-for-food deal in Iraq weighs on stock market.
- King pays tribute to Washington's gesture as clear indication of U.S.-Jordanian friendship.
